intro: Gonzalagunia dicocca subsp. venezuelensis, commonly known as the Venezuelan gonzalagunia, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Venezuela. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of red and yellow. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
